docs.snippet: 17--The German Legation tonight made public Captain Hans Langsdorff's protest over the time limit granted the raider Admiral Graf Spee to stay in port to make herself seaworthy. Addressed to the German Minister to Montevideo, Otto Langmann, and dated...
docs.lead_paragraph: 17--The German Legation tonight made public Captain Hans Langsdorff's protest over the time limit granted the raider Admiral Graf Spee to stay in port to make herself seaworthy. Addressed to the German Minister to Montevideo, Otto Langmann, and dated aboard the Admiral Graf Spee today, it read:

docs.snippet: The most dramatic episode of the war thus far has ended as abruptly as it began. A few minutes after the German pocket-battleship Graf Spee moved slowly out through the Montevideo harbor she was scuttled by her crew and swiftly sank. Her career of...
docs.lead_paragraph: The most dramatic episode of the war thus far has ended as abruptly as it began. A few minutes after the German pocket-battleship Graf Spee moved slowly out through the Montevideo harbor she was scuttled by her crew and swiftly sank. Her career of troublemaking against Allied shipping was over.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 17 (AP)--Uruguay suggested today that members of the Pan-American conference make representations to Britain and Germany protesting against their warships' battle within the American neutrality zone.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Dec. 17 (AP)--Uruguay suggested today that members of the Pan-American conference make representations to Britain and Germany protesting against their warships' battle within the American neutrality zone.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 17--British rejoicing over the news of the end of the Admiral Graf Spee was universal tonight, but tempered with a bitter dose of tragedy in the navy and in many homes throughout the ports of Britain.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 17--British rejoicing over the news of the end of the Admiral Graf Spee was universal tonight, but tempered with a bitter dose of tragedy in the navy and in many homes throughout the ports of Britain.

headline.main: REICH IS EXPECTED TO DROP SPEE CASE; Berlin Views Protest Over Uruguay's Refusal of More Time as Diplomatic TACTICS GOVERNED SINKING Other Nazi Warcraft Unable to Aid Pocket Battleship--News Stuns German People URUGUAY FIRM ON RULING Rejects German Charge on Time Needed for Spee's Repairs

byline.original: By PERCIVAL KNAUTH Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 18--The war at sea seemed today to have reached that phase that all British shippings has feared since the first day of September, the phase of attack by German planes on any and all ships approaching the shores of Great Britain.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 18--The war at sea seemed today to have reached that phase that all British shippings has feared since the first day of September, the phase of attack by German planes on any and all ships approaching the shores of Great Britain.
docs.abstract: German planes attack 24 Brit and neutral ships approaching Brit shores; Brit trawlers, Compagnus, New Choice and Isabella Greg sunk; trawler Pearl left in sinking condition; SS Tuscan Star and Ital freighter Valentino Coda attacked; 7 additional trawlers listed as attacked; 3 ships overdue

headline.main: WIDE RAIDS LOOSED ON BRITISH SHIPPING; Twenty-four Craft Attacked by Planes Near Coast-- Four of Them Sunk FIVE OTHER VESSELS LOST One a Norwegian Freighter-- Germans Scuttle Craft-- British Give Up Three Total Losses Not Known Other Attacks Reported Raiders Eluded British Planes Lloyd's Lists Losses Berlin Confirms Activity Norwegian Freighter Lost
